Freetown, MA has a population of 9,000.
The department is headed by a police chief.  The next level of supervision is a LT.  A sgt supervises each shift.  Total staff of 17.
We have about 12 vehicles.  No CSO's.

answers.author: John Doan
answers.text:
Tumwater, WA has a population of about 18,000.
There are 27 commissioned officers. One chief and one commander system. There are four lieutenants what supervise 14 patrol officers. One additional lt. supervises three detectives and a CSO who is responsible for evidence management. One additional lt. (designated as the admin. lt.) supervises the two traffic officers and the transport CSO (who moves people to and from jail and court). We have very limited parking at our City Hall so we have  a full take-home car program and each officer has a car. That would be 27 cars, both marked and unmarked, with a typical vehicle life of 7-8 years. The CSOs are both armed but have have a limited commission. They also do other duties like community events, parking enforcement, etc. There are 3.5 administrative support staff.

answers.author: Dennis Gehrt
answers.text:
Andy:  Population of 4,900 in major metro area.  Force has 11 sworn officers with one civilian admin asst, no CSO.  Consists of Chief, Investigator (Lt), three Sgts who are patrol watch supervisors and six patrol officers.  Have 3 patrol vehicles on four year rotations, one unmarked vehicle also used for patrol during maintenance rotation (one 7 year rotation) and 1 SUV for investigations use (on seven year rotation).  No take home vehicles.  Officers must live within 30 minute response time of station.  Dispatch, booking and detention provided by County Sheriff (we are county seat).  SO/Jail/Dispatch is immediately adjacent to PD.

answers.author: Eric Norenberg
answers.text:
Hello:  Oberlin's population is 8,286.  Here are the other numbers: 
1 Chief, 2 Lieutenants, 3 Sergeants 
11 FT officers 
1 PT officer
5 FT dispatchers
4 PT dispatchers 
5 other, non-sworn personnel :  (1 - Adm. Asst, 1 CSO and 3 PT Auxiliary officers)
15 vehicles - (Only the K-9 officer and detective have take home vehicles)
Our command structure was revised a few years ago to eliminate the captain position in favor of two lieutenants (1- Operations, 1 - Administrative).  
Our facility is co-located with a municipal court that serves a large portion of the county, so our dispatchers are also deputy court clerks for the filings related to arrests outside our jurisdiction and our jail provides holding for the court during the day.  However, for the most part prisoners are only in our jail until they can be transferred to the county jail.

answers.author: William Fraser
answers.text:
Montpelier VT - population 8,000.  1 Police Chief, 4 Sergeants.  3 Corporals (union positions, only act as supervisors if Sergeants are out).  1 Detective, 1 School Resource Officer, 6 patrol officers.  (16 sworn officers total)  1 civilian admin asst.  1 Senior Dispatcher, 5.5 Dispatchers.  1 FT, 3 PT parking enforcement.  7 vehicles (1 for Chief, 1 for SRO, 1 for Canine, 1 unmarked, 3 Patrol (1 of them 4WD).   Only Chief and Canine can bring cars home - Chief lives in our city.  We run three 8 hour shifts per day, each shift is supervised by a Sergeant (or Corporal if Sgt is out).  No less than two people per shift.  Usually 3 during day, 4 during evening and 2 overnight.  More if big event occurring.

answers.author: gary  tyson
answers.text:
Siler City, N.C. population is 9,000.  ( 21 Officers  and 5 non sworn )  We have a Chief, Major, 2 LT, 4 Sergeants, the rest Master officers and Officers.  Everyone has their own vehicle except the non sworn.  As far as Community service officers, each of our officers are task with doing community service type actitives as they arrise.  I expect my officers to get to know the various folks with in the community they work, along with participating in various events / programs that bring the police and community together on normal days when their is not a emergency.  I have found that this pays big dividends when there is an emergency.

answers.author: Daniel Ortiz-Hernandez
answers.text:
Kimball, NE (population 2,500) - We have the following
Chief - 1
Captain - 1
Sergeant - 1
Officers - 3
Admin assistant/dispatcher (40hrs/week, Monday thru Friday) - 1
We contract with the county for dispatching services during times when our dispatcher is out. Currently trying to start up a school resource officer if grant funding comes through. Officers have take home vehicle as they are often on call should back-up is needed. Police officers also field animal control calls. We have an agreement with a local vet though we will be modifying our agreement so that we are not burden with cats.
